bill_title: authorize the Game, Fish and Parks Commission to revise certain provisions related to the licensing of and hunting methods used by disabled hunters.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to authorize the Game, Fish and Parks Commission to promulgate rules to permit certain mobility-impaired hunters and disabled hunters to hunt from a stationary motor vehicle. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 41-8-37 be amended to read as follows: 41-8-37. No person, who is in or on a motor vehicle, may discharge a firearm or bow and arrow at any wild animals except coyotes, jackrabbits, rodents, skunks, badgers, raccoons, and foxes. Licensed hunters who : (1) Who are mobility-impaired; or (2) Who are paraplegics or otherwise physically unable to walk with or without crutches, braces, or other mechanical support , ; and who have been issued a mobility-impaired permit or disabled hunter permit by the department , may shoot in fields, woods, or from public roads from a stationary motor vehicle while hunting game animals or game birds in accordance with the conditions of the permit and rules promulgated by the Game, Fish and Parks Commission pursuant to chapter 1-26 . The commission shall promulgate rules pursuant to chapter 1-26 to establish the definition of mobility-impaired; the eligibility criteria, application, and approval procedures for issuance of a mobility-impaired permit or disabled hunter permit; the duration of a permit; and the extent of the permitted shooting activities. A violation of this section is a Class 2 misdemeanor.

bill_versions.bill_version: House Agriculture and Natural Resources Engrossed
bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to authorize the Game, Fish and Parks Commission to promulgate rules to permit certain mobility-impaired hunters and disabled hunters to hunt from a stationary motor vehicle and to permit certain persons to operate and ride on an off- road vehicle while in possession of a loaded and uncased firearm. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 41-8-37 be amended to read as follows: 41-8-37. No person, who is in or on a motor vehicle, may discharge a firearm or bow and arrow at any wild animals except coyotes, jackrabbits, rodents, skunks, badgers, raccoons, and foxes. Licensed hunters who : (1) Who are mobility-impaired; or (2) Who are paraplegics or otherwise physically unable to walk with or without crutches, braces, or other mechanical support , ; and who have been issued a mobility-impaired permit or disabled hunter permit by the department , may shoot in fields, woods, or from public roads from a stationary motor vehicle while hunting game animals or game birds in accordance with the conditions of the permit and rules promulgated by the Game, Fish and Parks Commission pursuant to chapter 1-26 . The commission shall promulgate rules pursuant to chapter 1-26 to establish the definition of mobility-impaired; the eligibility criteria, application, and approval procedures for issuance of a mobility-impaired permit or disabled hunter permit; the duration of a permit; and the extent of the permitted shooting activities. A violation of this section is a Class 2 misdemeanor. Section 2. That § 32-20-6.6 be amended to read as follows: 32-20-6.6. No person, other than a law enforcement officer or conservation officer, or any person on the person's own land or land leased by the person, may operate or ride on any motorcycle or off-road vehicle with any firearm in the person's possession unless the firearm is completely unloaded and within a carrying case which encloses the entire firearm. However, this section does not apply to any person who is carrying a pistol and possesses a permit to carry a concealed pistol issued pursuant to chapter 23-7. This section does not apply to any person who holds a permit issued pursuant to § 41-8-37 while engaged in hunting from an off-road vehicle in accordance with the provisions of the permit. This section shall be enforced by all law enforcement officers including conservation officers, notwithstanding the provisions of § 41-15-10.1. A violation of this section is a Class 2 misdemeanor.

bill_versions.bill_version: Senate Agriculture and Natural Resources Engrossed
bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to authorize the Game, Fish and Parks Commission to revise certain provisions related to the licensing of and hunting methods used by disabled hunters. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 41-8-37 be amended to read as follows: 41-8-37. No person, who is in or on a motor vehicle, may discharge a firearm or bow and arrow at any wild animals except coyotes, jackrabbits, rodents, skunks, badgers, raccoons, and foxes. Licensed hunters who are paraplegics or otherwise physically unable to walk with or without crutches, braces, or other mechanical support , or who are otherwise considered to be limited or impaired in their ability to walk, and who have been issued a disabled hunter permit by the department , may shoot in fields, woods, or from public roads from a stationary motor vehicle while hunting game animals or game birds in accordance with the conditions of the permit and rules promulgated by the Game, Fish and Parks Commission pursuant to chapter 1-26 . The commission shall promulgate rules pursuant to chapter 1-26 to establish the definition of disabled hunter; the eligibility criteria, application, and approval procedures for issuance of a disabled hunter permit; the duration of a permit; and the extent of the permitted shooting activities. A violation of this section is a Class 2 misdemeanor. Section 2. That § 32-20-6.6 be amended to read as follows: 32-20-6.6. No person, other than a law enforcement officer or conservation officer, or any person on the person's own land or land leased by the person, may operate or ride on any motorcycle or off-road vehicle with any firearm in the person's possession unless the firearm is completely unloaded and within a carrying case which encloses the entire firearm. However, this section does not apply to any person who is carrying a pistol and possesses a permit to carry a concealed pistol issued pursuant to chapter 23-7. This section does not apply to any person who holds a permit issued pursuant to § 41-8-37 while engaged in hunting from an off-road vehicle in accordance with the provisions of the permit. This section shall be enforced by all law enforcement officers including conservation officers , notwithstanding the provisions of § 41-15-10.1 . A violation of this section is a Class 2 misdemeanor.
